file_content.text: Mission complete = optimal parameters // Celebratory protocols = commenced
Empire = supreme // Specialists = defeat imminent
Identity = Emperor's Wrath // Battle skills + visceral intimidation = optimal suitability
Identity = Dark Council member // Additional criteria = overridden
Identity = confirmed against trusted operatives database // Top pay scale = authorized
Identity = Makeb team commander // Further information = unavailable
Identity confirmed = former operatives // Database reports mission success = ninety-eight percent // Suitability = optimal
Designated alert level = reached // Captain Hanthor = notified
Thanks, D3.
Oh, I--hello again. After that business with the Lurker, I'd hoped not to trouble you further. Unfortunately, the Hutts' latest plan leaves me in need of help.
Speak up, Captain. If there's a matter that concerns the Empire, it concerns me.
Spit it out.
As you say, my lord.
I'll give you a chance to pique my interest again, Captain, but no guarantees.
Perhaps I'll help.
You honor me, my lord.
You know my skills and my rates already, Hanthor. Are you hiring or what?
One expert, right here.
Hiring, certainly, and not for any simple matter.
Whatever's happening on Makeb is going to have repercussions elsewhere. If this concerns Szajin and his ambitions, I want to know about it.
I need insight into the Hutts.
You're overly familiar, whoever you are.
Have we met?
Sorry, pal, I meet a lot of people, and that uniform's none too memorable.
Who are you?
Captain Hanthor. You assisted me in dealing with the informant called the Lurker. I'd really appreciate your help again.
Oh, I--pardon the extra checks. The Hutts are making trouble, and with the situation here, I'm taking every precaution I can.
I'll overlook the inconvenience just once, Captain, provided you explain what's going on here.
I suggest you explain.
At once, my lord.
I'll excuse the inconvenience, if only because your droid has the good sense to know whom it's bothering.
You have respect, at least.
Thank you, my lord. Let me elaborate.
No denying they're dangerous, but in the end, a Hutt's just a four-meter-wide target that can't move.
Hutts don't scare me.
In this case, they've provided a challenge.
Something to bear in mind, Captain: There's a time for precautions and a time when they get in the way.
And then some, it seems.
Excuse me, I'm still rather n--new at this.
I thought Szajin was busy creating his new Hutt Empire. It sounds like he's planning more than his throne room.
What are the Hutts up to?
Security's one thing, but having this... thing underfoot isn't making you any friends.
Your droid's annoying me.
Forgive me, but until this crisis is past, I need every tool at my disposal.
Apparently, Szajin, this "Hutt Archon," has built an elite team, the Specialists, to eliminate any Imperial elements on Makeb.
The Specialists are five infamous bounty hunters, assassins and murderers. It won't take them long to destroy our bases... and put an end to your mission.
These Specialists are meant to draw everyone's attention away from stabilizing Makeb.
They're a distraction.
True, but we really can't afford to simply ignore them.
I should know who I'm up against.
Who are these Specialists?
These Specialists need to learn whose turf they're stepping on.
I don't like competition.
Szajin can build an army of Specialists for all I care. Everyone who's opposed me has come to a bad end.
Five, ten, they'll still die.
Of course, but how long would the support team last if the Specialists reach them?
I have compiled dossiers on each of the Specialists, if you'd like to, um, view them.
Let's see who the Archon considers to be "elite."
Yes, go ahead.
As you say. D3?
Their leader calls himself the Ratcatcher. He's a bounty hunter of renown, hired only by word of mouth. He's assassinated everyone from corporate heads to Moffs.
QO-99. My sources can't tell me his origins or even what he's built of.
Obviously he wasn't created for diplomacy and protocol.
He looks like a battle droid.
Oh, no question of that.
I'll try to leave him in one piece.
It might be worth finding out.
QO-99 operates the Ratcatcher's probe droids and automated assassins. Very, very dangerous.
I'll find out when I encounter him. Who else?
Give me the next dossier.
Next is....
Cheiko Bes was once a Jedi, but during the rise of the Dread Masters, she... lapsed. She's killed dozens across the Outer Rim, not always for credits.
This is Specter-12. It's rumored he was part of a government black-ops team.
Was he part of Imperial Intelligence? Or did he work for the Republic?
On which side?
No one knows. His training's unlike anything we've seen before. They say he can vanish in a crowded room.
Gossip and pseudonyms aren't much to go on, Captain.
I'd like more than rumors.
I'm sorry, but we don't know anything more. Specter-12 is well named.
I don't want to spend all day looking at these. Get to the end.
Bored now.
Finally, Tarklan, a Mantellian savrip. He possesses incredible strength and cunning. When all else fails, there is brute force.
I'll meet these Specialists when I kill them.
Skip to the end.
Ah. V--very good.
We might still be able to contain the threat. These Specialists are supposed to be arriving via one of the gravity hooks.
If you could sabotage the gravity hook's docking ring first, the Specialists would be trapped and much easier prey.
Leave this to me. These Specialists sound worthy of my time and my lightsaber.
I will take care of them.
Sabotage and hunting elite killers out for Imperial blood. What's not to like?
Sounds delightful.
I'll be back with the Specialists' heads before you can finish writing my paycheck.
Easy prey, easy money.
I'll be relying on you and your men to track the Specialists if any slip past me, Captain.
Make sure they stay contained.
Absolutely I will. But if the docking ring's sabotaged fast enough, they should have nowhere to go.
I'm not too familiar with gravity hook operations. Is there a red button to push, or--?
Sabotage it how?
Destroy a few key systems, and the docking ring will be inoperable. And you'll need to stop the ground crew from repairing it.
Suggestion noted, but maybe you should leave the details of this operation to me.
Stay out of this, Captain.
Of course, my lord, I apologize.
Yes--yes, of course.
You can contact me from the docking ring once everything's secure. I'll warn our allies to stay alert until then.
Every one of them will thank you for this. The Specialists could undo everything we've fought for. Good luck.
D3-X9 = running diagnostics // Try again later
Show me, and do it fast. The enemy won't wait.
Be quick about it.
